intro: Kosteletzkya coulteri, commonly known as Coulter's sea oxeye, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Texas and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils along the shoreline, showing a preference for well-drained environments. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Kosteletzkya coulteri is often found in maritime dune habitats and plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
